message: Predictions for best picture?  I'd like to see Inception win, but Social Network will probably go home with the award

I totally agree with you about Inception.  I just saw The Fighter last weekend and I have to say that Christain Bale deserves every accolade he receives.  His performance was great.  I loved this movie.
sweet
woa I totally thought gasland was going to win.  Exit through the giftshop was more of a mocumentary
there's a TV in the next room, but I'm getting the Oscar news from Twitter
it's officially the future in my apartment
also her dress didn't do much for me. it looked like sparkly skin.
she's a vampire!
hahah
ah, I bet it's just a steak baby
I see Social Network winning.
@gggritso ya I thought it was pretty good
short film winner is awesome.  he looks like a huge nerd.
lol. he doesn't own a shirt
I'd like to see The Social Network win, I loved that movie
that sounds pretty terrible
my God, these introductions take ages
oh, did she win something!?
I should have said "does he STILL date biel"
haha. totally.
I still haven't seen The King's Speech though, so it's not like I'm making an informed decision :)
hey, nothing wrong with going with your gut
woop woop inception won an award!
that movie was pretty great, too
so, what do we think of Gwyneth Paltrow becoming a country singer?
total meh
ya, the show drags on vorever
yep, supporting actress
I might just go to bed and check a summary in the morning, this is ridiculous
natalie portman looks really pregnant.
ha. naw i think it's really a baby, and she's crying
whoops i meant best actress
ahh, Mr Firth!
I really gotta see that movie
I haven't seen The Kings Speech.  I imagine I'll love it, but I'm still guessing I will feel like The Social Network was snubbed.
me too, I havent seen the king's speech.. someday I will download it.. =)
I will recommend Restrepo.  One of the nominees for best doc. And it's streamable on Netflix!
I saw Restrepo a while back, and it's pretty great
how the HECK did Christopher Nolan NOT get best screenplay for Inception? -.-
I'm pissed about the Oscars (as per usual)
@levifig I wondered the exact same thing. This is why I never bother watching. I just look at all the results the next day and disagree with many of them, haha.
yeah, I didnt like the results too.. =( .. I dont know how they judge every movie.. what method they use..
@Josesordo Ever heard of politics?? Hollywood doesn't like Christopher Nolan…
@levifig oh.. is like politics.. grr =)
lol, I mean.. =(
Ya, it's pretty sad! I read an article (before the Oscars but can't remember the link) that talked about how "Hollywood" think Nolan is not that good… :S

@levifig If you manage to dig that link up, be sure to share it. I would be interested in giving it a read. It seems surprising considering some of the creative works he's come up with like Memento and Inception.

@JohnFail I can't seem to find it, but if you search for "Christopher Nolan Hollywood" or "Christopher Nolan Batman 3D" you'll get a glimpse of what I mean (hint: he's mostly anti-3D even though the studios wanted him to shoot Batman in 3D… :p) —http://herocomplex.latimes.com/2010/12/08/christopher-nolan-hollywood-takes-too-many-shortcuts/
@levifig That actually makes me respect Nolan even more considering I haven't been much of a fan of the current 3D fad everyone seems to be going crazy over.
